skillTree.localised_description: The weight of every single insult, grievance, umbrage and ill-feeling, channelled into a single, crushing swing of the axe.
It's a crazy piece of acrobatics, for sure, but it might just work; if it does, the opponent has no chance.
All Dwarfs despise the Greenskins, for the urki and grobi are the prime agents in the Times of Woe.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins

skillTree.localised_description: Dwarfs are resolute - once they commit to charging the foe, they put all their strength behind that initial blow.
The endless courage of the Warrior God, directed to bolster this Dawi’s own reserves.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Distinguished by his scars he may be, but since the point of being a Slayer is to die, one wonders when this one is going to start applying himself to the task at hand.

skillTree.localised_name: Army of One, Slayer of Many
skillTree.localised_description: Some people don't need friends; in fact, friends might get in the way and be accidentally killed in a particularly nasty way.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: "Daemons? Pah – I shit 'em."

effects.description:
Ward save: 5% when fighting against Daemons of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 when fighting against Daemons of Chaos
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even the greatest of Daemons have been defeated on their travels, and oft-times by one such as this.
"If you're gonna die, die with yer boots on!" -- Ancient Slayer proverb

attributes.bullet_text: Entities in this unit take damage, but cannot die.

effects.description:
Bonus vs Large: +10 for Slayers, Slayer Pirates and Giant Slayers units
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs Infantry: +10 for Doomseekers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Many a tale, many a promise, and many a grave threat is scored into these fleshy drapes, detailing a life spent in the dogged pursuit of death…  and chiefly, their own!

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for Slayers, Giant Slayers, Slayer Pirates, Goblin Hewer and Doomseekers units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% for Slayer Pirates and Goblin Hewer units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The deeds of this one's life are told through the many scars that adorn his timeworn and battle-aged skin.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 15% for Slayers, Giant Slayers, Slayer Pirates, Goblin Hewer and Doomseekers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When led by a Dwarf of sufficient calibre, a band of Slayers is many times more lethal – speeding to the heart of the action to cut it from the foe's still-screaming body!

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for Slayers, Giant Slayers, Slayer Pirates, Goblin Hewer and Doomseekers units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -10% for Slayers, Giant Slayers, Slayer Pirates, Goblin Hewer and Doomseekers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Many blows over many battles have hardened this warrior beyond compare, making his hide as tough as Dragon scales.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Dwarfs are not fast, yet they will soldier on, always moving despite any hazards encountered.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Lord and his az are never separated, for it is as much part of him as his beard.

skillTree.localised_description: The Dawi continually push the boundaries of engineering, be it by soaring ever higher in their flying contraptions or firing projectiles farther than ever before.

skillTree.localised_description: Only Dwarfen forges burn hotter than those unfortunates caught in the blaze of Dawi ingenuity.

skillTree.localised_description: Full of grim determination, when Dwarfs join battle there is no retreat, only victory or death.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who pass the trials of the Ancestor God have proven their honour without question.

skillTree.localised_description: None know the strength of the Dawi better than those who've suffered their firepower firsthand.

skillTree.localised_description: Morgrim's favour is not handed out on a whim; this god blesses only the truest disciples of Dawi engineering.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Dwarf spent time in the pits, gaining a Miner's intuition of the dangers and prey to be found in the dark.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +6%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +16%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: "I have seen better lavatory walls than this - I'll have it down by the morrow, that's a pledge!"

skillTree.localised_description: A Dwarf with a fine beard is as Dawi as they come.
Lords close to the powerful Masons' Guild will get discounts for labour and materials.

Construction cost: -2% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings
	(local region)

	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Such a Dawi does not care for being wounded - by his will alone he continues to fight.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

skillTree.localised_description: "All Dwarfs to me! We have grudges to settle - Grimnir demands it!"
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: A wise Lord will gather Engineers to his service, ensuring the Dwarfs maintain their technological edge.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit is a Slayer. Slayers can never have their Weapon Strength reduced during a battle.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit. (Maximum intensity at 300 kills)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This brave Dawi can trace his lineage back to Grimnir, the Warrior-God.
This industrious Dawi can trace his lineage back to Grungni, God of Mines and Smiths.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -15% for all buildings
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This loyal Dawi can trace his lineage back to Valaya, Goddess of Healing and Protection.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +6 when fighting against armies that spread corruption
	(own army)

Melee attack: +6 when fighting against armies that spread corruption
	(own army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +25%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab or gouge, it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +500 metres without incurring any time penalty

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Fortunately, this Dawi is just as dedicated to the advancement of his people as he is to drinking his own body weight, and yours, in Bugman's Best every night.

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: As a Dawi elder statesman, who has lived long and seen much, this one is one of the most respected figures in his Hold.
Stout and sturdy, as every good Dawi should be.
